meanings.definition: The chemical decomposition of a substance by radiation.
meanings.sent1: Radiolysis can change the structure of molecules.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study radiolysis to understand how radiation affects materials.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the radiolysis of the compound created unexpected results.
meanings.sent4: The radiolysis of the material was like a silent chemical reaction triggered by radiation.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration vividly showed the effects of radiolysis on the substance.

meanings.definition: The process of breaking down molecules in a material by exposure to radiation.
meanings.sent1: Exposure to radiation can lead to radiolysis of the material.
meanings.sent2: Radiolysis is a crucial concept in nuclear chemistry.
meanings.sent3: The radiolysis of the polymer under the UV light was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The radiolysis of the compound was like a slow-motion disintegration under the radiation.
meanings.sent5: The vivid demonstration illustrated the effects of radiolysis on the material.
